channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Automatic Evaluation of Excavator Operators using Learned Reward Functions
item.description: Training novice users to operate an excavator for learning different skills requires the presence of expert teachers.

item.title: Model free Shapley values for high dimensional data
item.description: On a problem from high energy physics we verify that IGCS has nearly the same AUCs as CS.

item.title: Show Me the Instruments: Musical Instrument Retrieval from Mixture Audio
item.description: The Single-Instrument Encoder is trained to classify the instruments used in single-track audio, and we take its penultimate layer's activation as the instrument embedding.

item.title: Characterizing the Spectrum of the NTK via a Power Series Expansion
item.description: We observe faster decay of the Hermite coefficients leads to faster decay in the NTK coefficients.

item.title: Unveiling interpretable development-specific gene signatures in the developing human prefrontal cortex with ICGS
item.description: In this paper, to unveil interpretable development-specific gene signatures in human PFC, we propose a novel gene selection method, named Interpretable Causality Gene Selection (ICGS), which adopts a Bayesian Network (BN) to represent causality between multiple gene variables and a development variable.

item.title: Galactica: A Large Language Model for Science
item.description: And despite not being trained on a general corpus, Galactica outperforms BLOOM and OPT-175B on BIG-bench.

item.title: Multilingual and Multimodal Topic Modelling with Pretrained Embeddings
item.description: This paper presents M3L-Contrast -- a novel multimodal multilingual (M3L) neural topic model for comparable data that maps texts from multiple languages and images into a shared topic space.

item.title: CardiacGen: A Hierarchical Deep Generative Model for Cardiac Signals
item.description: We present CardiacGen, a Deep Learning framework for generating synthetic but physiologically plausible cardiac signals like ECG.

item.title: REPAIR: REnormalizing Permuted Activations for Interpolation Repair
item.description: In this paper we look into the conjecture of Entezari et al.(2021) which states that if the permutation invariance of neural networks is taken into account, then there is likely no loss barrier to the linear interpolation between SGD solutions.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Question Answering over Knowledge Bases
item.description: In that, we study various question types, properties, languages, and domains to provide insights on where existing systems struggle.

item.title: Machine learning for interpreting coherent X-ray speckle patterns
item.description: Speckle patterns produced by coherent X-ray have a close relationship with the internal structure of materials but quantitative inversion of the relationship to determine structure from images is challenging.

item.title: Evaluating the Factual Consistency of Large Language Models Through Summarization
item.description: To generate summaries that are factually inconsistent, we generate summaries from a suite of summarization models that we have manually annotated as factually inconsistent.

item.title: A Benchmark and Dataset for Post-OCR text correction in Sanskrit
item.description: Keeping this in mind, we release a multi-domain dataset, from areas as diverse as astronomy, medicine and mathematics, with some of them as old as 18 centuries.

item.title: Neural Bayesian Network Understudy
item.description: Bayesian Networks may be appealing for clinical decision-making due to their inclusion of causal knowledge, but their practical adoption remains limited as a result of their inability to deal with unstructured data.

item.title: Multi-Label Quantification
item.description: While many quantification methods have been proposed in the past for binary problems and, to a lesser extent, single-label multiclass problems, the multi-label setting (i. e., the scenario in which the classes of interest are not mutually exclusive) remains by and large unexplored.

item.title: On Inferring User Socioeconomic Status with Mobility Records
item.description: The DeepSEI model incorporates two networks called deep network and recurrent network, which extract the features of the mobility records from three aspects, namely spatiality, temporality and activity, one at a coarse level and the other at a detailed level.

item.title: Versatile Diffusion: Text, Images and Variations All in One Diffusion Model
item.description: Through our experiments, we demonstrate that VD and its underlying framework have the following merits: a) VD handles all subtasks with competitive quality; b) VD initiates novel extensions and applications such as disentanglement of style and semantic, image-text dual-guided generation, etc.

item.title: Hierarchical Inference of the Lensing Convergence from Photometric Catalogs with Bayesian Graph Neural Networks
item.description: For each test set of 1, 000 sightlines, the BGNN infers the individual $\kappa$ posteriors, which we combine in a hierarchical Bayesian model to yield constraints on the hyperparameters governing the population.

item.title: Scene-to-Patch Earth Observation: Multiple Instance Learning for Land Cover Classification
item.description: Land cover classification (LCC), and monitoring how land use changes over time, is an important process in climate change mitigation and adaptation.

item.title: 3D Cascade RCNN: High Quality Object Detection in Point Clouds
item.description: Recent progress on 2D object detection has featured Cascade RCNN, which capitalizes on a sequence of cascade detectors to progressively improve proposal quality, towards high-quality object detection.

item.title: Towards an objective characterization of an individual's facial movements using Self-Supervised Person-Specific-Models
item.description: We propose self-supervised Person-Specific Models (PSMs), in which one model per individual can learn to extract an embedding of the facial movements independently of the person's identity and other structural facial characteristics from unlabeled facial video.

item.title: An FNet based Auto Encoder for Long Sequence News Story Generation
item.description: In this paper, we design an auto encoder based off of Google's FNet Architecture in order to generate text from a subset of news stories contained in Google's C4 dataset.

item.title: Evaluating the Faithfulness of Saliency-based Explanations for Deep Learning Models for Temporal Colour Constancy
item.description: The opacity of deep learning models constrains their debugging and improvement.

item.title: Anomaly Detection in Multiplex Dynamic Networks: from Blockchain Security to Brain Disease Prediction
item.description: The problem of identifying anomalies in dynamic networks is a fundamental task with a wide range of applications.

item.title: Probabilistic Deep Metric Learning for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: We propose to learn a global probabilistic distribution for each pixel in the patch and a probabilistic metric to model the distance between distributions.

item.title: Music Instrument Classification Reprogrammed
item.description: The performance of approaches to Music Instrument Classification, a popular task in Music Information Retrieval, is often impacted and limited by the lack of availability of annotated data for training.

item.title: Hierarchical Phrase-based Sequence-to-Sequence Learning
item.description: We describe a neural transducer that maintains the flexibility of standard sequence-to-sequence (seq2seq) models while incorporating hierarchical phrases as a source of inductive bias during training and as explicit constraints during inference.

item.title: Mechanistic Mode Connectivity
item.description: We define a notion of $\textit{mechanistic similarity}$ and demonstrate that lack of linear connectivity between two minimizers implies the corresponding models use dissimilar mechanisms for making their predictions.

item.title: Inferring cell-specific lncRNA regulation with single-cell RNA-sequencing data in the developing human neocortex
item.description: However, to analyze lncRNA regulation regarding individual cells, we focus on single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNA-seq) data instead of bulk data.

item.title: SPE-Net: Boosting Point Cloud Analysis via Rotation Robustness Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel deep architecture tailored for 3D point cloud applications, named as SPE-Net.

item.title: MM-Locate-News: Multimodal Focus Location Estimation in News
item.description: In this paper, a novel dataset called Multimodal Focus Location of News (MM-Locate-News) is introduced.

item.title: Dynamic Temporal Filtering in Video Models
item.description: The pre-determined kernel size severely limits the temporal receptive fields and the fixed weights treat each spatial location across frames equally, resulting in sub-optimal solution for long-range temporal modeling in natural scenes.

item.title: Harmonization Benchmarking Tool for Neuroimaging Datasets
item.description: A major data pre-processing step for large, multi-site studies is to handle site effects by harmonizing data, generating a dataset that enables more powerful analyses and more robust algorithms.

item.title: Finding Skill Neurons in Pre-trained Transformer-based Language Models
item.description: Furthermore, we demonstrate the skill neurons are most likely generated in pre-training rather than fine-tuning by showing that the skill neurons found with prompt tuning are also crucial for other fine-tuning methods freezing neuron weights, such as the adapter-based tuning and BitFit.

item.title: Towards A Unified Conformer Structure: from ASR to ASV Task
item.description: Transformer has achieved extraordinary performance in Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision tasks thanks to its powerful self-attention mechanism, and its variant Conformer has become a state-of-the-art architecture in the field of Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR).

item.title: Are Hard Examples also Harder to Explain? A Study with Human and Model-Generated Explanations
item.description: We observe that (1) GPT-3 explanations are as grammatical as human explanations regardless of the hardness of the test samples, (2) for easy examples, GPT-3 generates highly supportive explanations but human explanations are more generalizable, and (3) for hard examples, human explanations are significantly better than GPT-3 explanations both in terms of label-supportiveness and generalizability judgements.

item.title: FedCL: Federated Multi-Phase Curriculum Learning to Synchronously Correlate User Heterogeneity
item.description: A key challenge in FL is to handle the heterogeneity of local data distribution, resulting in a drifted global model, which is hard to converge.

item.title: Bayesian Reconstruction and Differential Testing of Excised mRNA
item.description: We show that BREM achieves higher F1 score for reconstruction tasks and improved accuracy and sensitivity in differential splicing when compared with four state-of-the-art transcript and local splicing methods on simulated data.

item.title: CST5: Data Augmentation for Code-Switched Semantic Parsing
item.description: To aid further research in this area, we are also releasing (a) Hinglish-TOP, the largest human annotated code-switched semantic parsing dataset to date, containing 10k human annotated Hindi-English (Hinglish) code-switched utterances, and (b) Over 170K CST5 generated code-switched utterances from the TOPv2 dataset.

item.title: Advancing the State-of-the-Art for ECG Analysis through Structured State Space Models
item.description: The field of deep-learning-based ECG analysis has been largely dominated by convolutional architectures.

item.title: MT4SSL: Boosting Self-Supervised Speech Representation Learning by Integrating Multiple Targets
item.description: In this paper, we provide a new perspective on self-supervised speech models from how the self-training targets are obtained.

item.title: Redeeming Intrinsic Rewards via Constrained Optimization
item.description: Such methods can lead to excellent results on hard exploration tasks but can suffer from intrinsic reward bias and underperform when compared to an agent trained using only task rewards.

item.title: What Images are More Memorable to Machines?
item.description: This paper studies the problem of measuring and predicting how memorable an image is to pattern recognition machines, as a path to explore machine intelligence.

item.title: MetaKRec: Collaborative Meta-Knowledge Enhanced Recommender System
item.description: To fill this gap, in this paper, we explore the rich, heterogeneous relationship among items and propose a new KG-enhanced recommendation model called Collaborative Meta-Knowledge Enhanced Recommender System (MetaKRec).

item.title: MedleyVox: An Evaluation Dataset for Multiple Singing Voices Separation
item.description: In this paper, we present an evaluation dataset and provide baseline studies for multiple singing voices separation.

item.title: Universal EHR Federated Learning Framework
item.description: Federated learning (FL) is the most practical multi-source learning method for electronic healthcare records (EHR).

item.title: Calibrated Interpretation: Confidence Estimation in Semantic Parsing
item.description: We examine the calibration characteristics of six models across three model families on two common English semantic parsing datasets, finding that many models are reasonably well-calibrated and that there is a trade-off between calibration and performance.

item.title: Dealing with missing data using attention and latent space regularization
item.description: Most practical data science problems encounter missing data.

item.title: Detecting Line Segments in Motion-blurred Images with Events
item.description: To robustly detect line segments over motion blurs, we propose to leverage the complementary information of images and events.

item.title: EVA: Exploring the Limits of Masked Visual Representation Learning at Scale
item.description: We launch EVA, a vision-centric foundation model to explore the limits of visual representation at scale using only publicly accessible data.
